name: The Quintessence of the Marvel Universe Trivia Quiz | Entertainment | 15 Questions

questions.text: Galactus (a.k.a. "the devourer of worlds") had a herald named Silver Surfer (a.k.a. Norrin Radd), what is his power called?
questions.explanation:
The Power Cosmic.

	When Norrin Radd's home world was endangered by the mighty planet devouring being known as Galactus, he did what he felt necessary to save it, he offered his services to Galactus. Galactus granted Norrin "The Power Cosmic" and made him his herald.

questions.text: Why wouldn't the United States army Accept Steve Rogers a.k.a. "Captain America" during WWII?
questions.correct: He was a sickly young man
options: He was unapplicable due to being a cripple
He was the only male in the family
questions.explanation:
He was a sickly young man.

	Upon seeing images of the war on a news reel, Steve Rogers was inspired to join the country's elite. The only problem was his weak body. When he was rejected he begged and pleaded to no avail. One of the higher-ups saw this young man's speech and offered to let him in on a top secret government experiment to create the perfect soldier. Rogers agreed and took a "super soldier serum". After months of extensive training in just about every fighting style Rogers became an Olympic level athlete. When Dr. Reinstein (the only man who knew the Super Soldier Serum's Formula) was shot and killed by a nazi spy, Captain America was born.

questions.text: Why does Tony Stark, a.k.a. "Iron Man," wear a suit of armor in battle?
options: To protect his easily pierced skin
It makes him invisible to his enemies
questions.explanation:
To protect his bad heart.

	Tony Stark, the head of Stark Industries, hurt his heart in Vietnam and risks having his heart stop under physically taxing situations. In order for Stark to follow the call to duty he had to use his own technology to build a suit to protect his heart.

questions.text: Which of these people do not have psychic abilities? (Meaning Telekinesis and/or Telepathy)
questions.explanation:
Shadowcat.

	Kitty Pride, a.k.a. "Shadowcat," has the ability to move through solid objects and walk on air.

questions.text: What robot was powerful enough to break the Hulk's leg?
options: MODOK (Mental Organism Designed Only for Killing)
questions.explanation:
Ultron.

	In "Secret Wars" #12 Ultron and Hulk battled breifly and out of sheer desperation Ultron shot Hulk in the leg with an energy blast breaking the green giant's leg.

questions.text: Who trained young Matt Murdock a.k.a. "Daredevil" after he lost his sight?
questions.explanation:
Stick.

	After Matt Murdock lost his sight in a freak accident involving a truck full of radioactive isotopes, he attempted to train himself, but to no avail. A man named Stick appeared out of nowhere and taught Matt how to use all of his remaining senses to his advantage. Without the physical and mental training, Matt would not be the man he is today.

questions.text: Name the original members of the X-Men?
questions.correct: Marvel Girl, Cyclops, Beast, Iceman, Angel
options: Havok, Polaris, Cyclops, Marvel Girl, Iceman
Beast, Havok, Banshee, Cyclops, Marvel Girl
Beast, Storm, Iceman, Cyclops, Marvel Girl
questions.explanation:
Marvel Girl, Cyclops, Beast, Iceman, Angel.

	When Professor Charles Xavier founded "Xavier's School for gifted youngsters" he had high hopes for making the world a better place, a place where humans and mutants could leave together in peace. His first recruits were very young and needed to be taught how to control their "gifts". When they learned to fully control their powers the X-Men were born.

questions.text: Which super-villian almost married Spider-Man's Aunt May?
questions.explanation:
Doc Ock.

	When Peter Parker found out his Aunt May was engaged to a criminal, he had no way of telling her without giving away his secret identity. And when Doc Ock and Spider-man clashed it got personal. After the battle, Ock left and Aunt May was heart-broken.

questions.text: Which super-villain killed Spider-Man's first love?
questions.explanation:
Green Goblin.

	In "Amazing Spider-Man" #121 the Goblin/Parker feud came to a dramatic climax when the Goblin threw Gwen Stacy off the Brooklin Bridge. Spidey thought he saved her with his webbing, but he soon found that her neck snapped from the force he used to catch her.

questions.text: Which one of these Marvel weddings never happened?
questions.explanation:
Hulk - She Hulk.

	The Hulk and She-Hulk would never get married because they're cousins!

questions.text: Which of these alien races are constantly fighting?
questions.explanation:
Kree - Skrulls.

	The Kree and the Skrulls have always been bitter enemies. Many characters in the Marvel Universe seem to get pulled into their battles.

questions.text: Which superhero tried to join the Fantastic Four early in his career?
questions.explanation:
Spider-Man.

	In "Amazing Spider-Man" #1 Spidey was in desperate need of money when he couldn't find a job. He thought he could get paid if he joined a super-team. He was rejected due to his crude methods of gettng their attention. It made matters worse when they told him they get funding through scientific research and not through being a super-team.

questions.text: What's the name of Thor's hammer?
questions.explanation:
Mjolnir.

	Mjolnir is indeed a god's hammer. In this case, the god of thunder, Thor. Thor was given the Hammer by his father Odin and is one of only a few pure souls who can wield it.

questions.text: What is Captain America's Shield made of?
questions.explanation:
Vibranium and Adamantium.

	Captain America's Shield is made of a Vibranium and Adamantium alloy that is indestructible.

questions.text: Who would take over Tony Stark's duties as Iron Man from time to time?
questions.explanation:
Jim Rhodes.

	When Tony Stark would leave town or just need time to rest, his good friend Jim Rhodes would don the iron suit.
